title: How to Verify a GPG Signature

steps.headline: Acquire the Public Key.
steps.description: Import the Public Key into GPG.

steps.headline: Acquire a copy of the file in question.
Acquire a copy of the signature-file in question.
steps.description: Save it in the same Folder.

parts.name: Using GPG to Verify that someone's Secret Key Signed the File in Question

steps.headline: Open a command-line interface.
steps.description: Change the working directory to the Folder where your file and signature-file are saved.

steps.headline: Verify the signature.
steps.description:
Type the following command into a command-line interface:
gpg --verify [signature-file] [file]
E.g., if you have acquired
(1) the Public Key 0x416F061063FEE659,
(2) the Tor Browser Bundle file (tor-browser.tar.gz), and
(3) the signature-file posted alongside the Tor Browser Bundle file (tor-browser.tar.gz.asc),
You would type the following:
gpg --verify tor-browser.tar.gz.asc tor-browser.tar.gz

text:
Downloading What You Need Acquire the Public Key. Import the Public Key into GPG. Acquire a copy of the file in question. Save it in a Folder. Acquire a copy of the signature-file in question. Save it in the same Folder. Using GPG to Verify that someone's Secret Key Signed the File in Question Open a command-line interface. Change the working directory to the Folder where your file and signature-file are saved. Verify the signature. Type the following command into a command-line interface:
gpg --verify [signature-file] [file]
E.g., if you have acquired
(1) the Public Key 0x416F061063FEE659,
(2) the Tor Browser Bundle file (tor-browser.tar.gz), and
(3) the signature-file posted alongside the Tor Browser Bundle file (tor-browser.tar.gz.asc),
You would type the following:
gpg --verify tor-browser.tar.gz.asc tor-browser.tar.gz
sentences: Downloading What You Need Acquire the Public Key.
Import the Public Key into GPG.
Acquire a copy of the file in question.
Acquire a copy of the signature-file in question.
Save it in the same Folder.
Using GPG to Verify that someone's Secret Key Signed the File in Question Open a command-line interface.
Change the working directory to the Folder where your file and signature-file are saved.

Type the following command into a command-line interface:
gpg --verify [signature-file] [file]
E.g., if you have acquired
(1) the Public Key 0x416F061063FEE659,
(2) the Tor Browser Bundle file (tor-browser.tar.gz), and
(3) the signature-file posted alongside the Tor Browser Bundle file (tor-browser.tar.gz.asc),
You would type the following:
gpg --verify tor-browser.tar.gz.asc tor-browser.tar.gz
